page.title: 10WILDLIFE IN SOUTH LINCS.
page.content: Red, fallow and muntjac deer are found in the woodlands. Periodically the Bourne and Pillow (Pillar) Woods are closed to the general public for the necessary culling of the deer. Grass snakes, long tailed voles, stoats and weasels abound in the woods. A variety of game breeds in the district including rabbits, hares, pheasant and partridge; but the partridge this year are scarce because of the wet weather during the breeding season. There are numerous grey squirrel, foxes and one or two badger sets. This year, thirteen fox cubs were found in some bales of hay on one farm, possibly from two litters.
